titleStmt.title: F. M. Webster to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1089

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Newport Ky Sep 30/64
Tho E Bramlette
Gov of Ky
Sir

Herewith I send you a copy of an indictment found in our court against Henry Holt -- He has fled from this state and is in the state of Ill as I am informed and believe -- It is desired by parties here who wish to have him brought to justice to obtain from you upon the Govr of Ill a Requisition for the fugitive & I write this in view of such proceeding.

I would suggest as a proper person to act as the agent of this state in the behalf M Cook Esqr who is City Marshal of this place
and who will I have no doubt be efficient and diligent in the discharge of Such duty.

I am most respectfully &c
F. M. Webster
City Atty Newport

Requisition Govr Illinois
apptd. M. Cook Agent
3rd Oct/64
